questions.question: Which macOS keyboard shortcut opens Spotlight search?
What is the quickest way to capture a selection screenshot on macOS?
questions.explain: Shift+Command+4 turns the cursor into a crosshair for selection captures.

questions.question: In iTerm2, which shortcut splits the current pane vertically?
questions.explain: Command+D creates a vertical split; Shift+D splits horizontally.

questions.question: What does Command+K do in iTerm2 by default?
questions.explain: Command+K clears the visible buffer without closing the session.

questions.question: Which shortcut opens the Command Palette in VS Code on macOS?
questions.explain: Command+Shift+P opens the Command Palette with all actions.

questions.question: How do you add an extra cursor with the mouse in VS Code on macOS?
questions.explain: Option+Click adds another cursor for multi-editing.

questions.question: Which Git command creates and checks out a new branch named feature/login?
questions.explain: git checkout -b <name> creates the branch and switches to it immediately.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a pull request on GitHub?
choices: To request review and discussion before merging
questions.explain: Pull requests enable code review, discussion, and checks before merging.

questions.question: Which statement best describes a foundation model?
choices: A model trained for one specific downstream task
A broadly pretrained model adapted to many tasks
A model that only runs on mobile devices
A rules engine with hard-coded logic
questions.explain: Foundation models are pretrained on diverse data and fine-tuned for multiple tasks.

questions.question: Which Core Web Vitals metric tracks perceived load speed of the main content?
questions.explain: Largest Contentful Paint measures when the biggest content element renders.

questions.question: What does a Content-Security-Policy (CSP) primarily do?
questions.explain: CSP reduces XSS risk by limiting which origins may supply resources.

questions.question: Which header tells browsers to prefer HTTPS for future requests?
questions.explain: Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) locks the origin to HTTPS once trusted.
